main event: The object was described as 'like a light, changing brightness, 1/2th the size of a star'. It was observed by one witness at Lynn, Massachusetts.
interesting points: The object was observed for 3-5 minutes, slowly swaying from the northwest to overhead and northward.
The cause of this sighting was not available, but it was classified as 'insufficient information, but probably a balloon'.
The object was described as brilliant and swaying in a typical balloon manner.
The length of the sighting and the location did not contain sufficient information to establish the nature of this sighting conclusively.
The witness was asked various questions about the weather conditions, direction, and other details of the sighting.
result: insufficient information, but probably a balloon
sighted object: a light, changing brightness, 1/2th the size of a star
